trans-unit.source: Python web and worker roles with Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Python web and worker roles with Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Overview of using Python Tools for Visual Studio to create Azure cloud services including web roles and worker roles.
trans-unit.target: Overview of using Python Tools for Visual Studio to create Azure cloud services including web roles and worker roles.

trans-unit.source: Python web and worker roles with Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Python web and worker roles with Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of using Python web and worker roles using <link><linkText>Python Tools for Visual Studio[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of using Python web and worker roles using <link><linkText>Python Tools for Visual Studio[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 or 2015
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 or 2015

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio[]</linkText><title></title></link> (PTVS)
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio[]</linkText><title></title></link> (PTVS)

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Azure SDK Tools for VS 2013[]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Azure SDK Tools for VS 2015[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Azure SDK Tools for VS 2013[]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Azure SDK Tools for VS 2015[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Python 2.7 32-bit[]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Python 3.4 32-bit[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Python 2.7 32-bit[]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Python 3.4 32-bit[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: What are Python web and worker roles?
trans-unit.target: What are Python web and worker roles?

trans-unit.source: Azure provides three compute models for running applications: <link><linkText>Web Apps feature in Azure App Service[execution model-web sites]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Machines[execution model-vms]</linkText><title></title></link>, and <link><linkText>Azure Cloud Services[execution model-cloud services]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Azure provides three compute models for running applications: <link><linkText>Web Apps feature in Azure App Service[execution model-web sites]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Machines[execution model-vms]</linkText><title></title></link>, and <link><linkText>Azure Cloud Services[execution model-cloud services]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: All three models support Python.
trans-unit.target: All three models support Python.

trans-unit.source: Cloud Services, which include web and worker roles, provide Platform as a Service (PaaS).
trans-unit.target: Cloud Services, which include web and worker roles, provide Platform as a Service (PaaS).

trans-unit.source: Within a cloud service, a web role provides a dedicated Internet Information Services (IIS) web server to host front-end web applications, while a worker role can run asynchronous, long-running or perpetual tasks independent of user interaction or input.
trans-unit.target: Within a cloud service, a web role provides a dedicated Internet Information Services (IIS) web server to host front-end web applications, while a worker role can run asynchronous, long-running or perpetual tasks independent of user interaction or input.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [What is a Cloud Service?].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [What is a Cloud Service?].

trans-unit.source: Looking to build a simple website?
trans-unit.target: Looking to build a simple website?

trans-unit.source: If your scenario involves just a simple website front-end, consider using the lightweight Web Apps feature in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: If your scenario involves just a simple website front-end, consider using the lightweight Web Apps feature in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: You can easily upgrade to a Cloud Service as your website grows and your requirements change.
trans-unit.target: You can easily upgrade to a Cloud Service as your website grows and your requirements change.

trans-unit.source: See the <html></html>Python Developer Center<html></html> for articles that cover development of the Web Apps feature in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: See the <html></html>Python Developer Center<html></html> for articles that cover development of the Web Apps feature in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Project creation
trans-unit.target: Project creation

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, you can select Azure Cloud Service in the New Project dialog box, under Python.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, you can select Azure Cloud Service in the New Project dialog box, under Python.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Project Dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Project Dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Cloud Service wizard, you can create new web and worker roles.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Cloud Service wizard, you can create new web and worker roles.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Cloud Service Dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Cloud Service Dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The worker role template comes with boilerplate code to connect to a Azure storage account or Azure Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: The worker role template comes with boilerplate code to connect to a Azure storage account or Azure Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cloud Service Solution</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cloud Service Solution</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can add web or worker roles to an existing cloud service at any time.
trans-unit.target: You can add web or worker roles to an existing cloud service at any time.

trans-unit.source: You can choose to add existing projects in your solution, or create new ones.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to add existing projects in your solution, or create new ones.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Role Command</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Role Command</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Your cloud service can contain roles implemented in different languages.
trans-unit.target: Your cloud service can contain roles implemented in different languages.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can have a Python web role implemented using Django, with Python, or with C# worker roles.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can have a Python web role implemented using Django, with Python, or with C# worker roles.

trans-unit.source: You can easily communicate between your roles using Service Bus queues or storage queues.
trans-unit.target: You can easily communicate between your roles using Service Bus queues or storage queues.

trans-unit.source: Run locally
trans-unit.target: Run locally

trans-unit.source: If you set your cloud service project as the startup project and press F5, the cloud service will run in the local Azure emulator.
trans-unit.target: If you set your cloud service project as the startup project and press F5, the cloud service will run in the local Azure emulator.

trans-unit.source: Although PTVS supports launching in the emulator, debugging (for example, breakpoints) will not work.
trans-unit.target: Although PTVS supports launching in the emulator, debugging (for example, breakpoints) will not work.

trans-unit.source: To debug your web and worker roles, you can set the role project as the startup project and debug that instead.
trans-unit.target: To debug your web and worker roles, you can set the role project as the startup project and debug that instead.

trans-unit.source: You can also set multiple startup projects.
trans-unit.target: You can also set multiple startup projects.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the solution and then select Set StartUp Projects.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the solution and then select Set StartUp Projects.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Solution Startup Project Properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Solution Startup Project Properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Publish to Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish to Azure

trans-unit.source: To publish, right-click the cloud service project in the solution and then select Publish.
trans-unit.target: To publish, right-click the cloud service project in the solution and then select Publish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft Azure Publish Sign In</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft Azure Publish Sign In</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the settings page, select the cloud service you want to publish to.
trans-unit.target: On the settings page, select the cloud service you want to publish to.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft Azure Publish Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft Azure Publish Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can create a new cloud service if you don't already have one available.
trans-unit.target: You can create a new cloud service if you don't already have one available.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create Cloud Service Dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create Cloud Service Dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: It's also useful to enable remote desktop connections to the machine(s) for debugging failures.
trans-unit.target: It's also useful to enable remote desktop connections to the machine(s) for debugging failures.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Remote Desktop Configuration Dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Remote Desktop Configuration Dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you are done configuring settings, click Publish.
trans-unit.target: When you are done configuring settings, click Publish.

trans-unit.source: Some progress will appear in the output window, then you'll see the Microsoft Azure Activity Log window.
trans-unit.target: Some progress will appear in the output window, then you'll see the Microsoft Azure Activity Log window.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft Azure Activity Log Window</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft Azure Activity Log Window</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Deployment will take several minutes to complete, then your web and/or worker roles will be running on Azure!
trans-unit.target: Deployment will take several minutes to complete, then your web and/or worker roles will be running on Azure!

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: For more detailed information about working with web and worker roles in Python Tools for Visual Studio, see the PTVS documentation:

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Cloud Service Projects[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: For more details about using Azure services from your web and worker roles, such as using Azure Storage or Service Bus, see the following articles.

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Queue Service[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Service Bus Queues[]</linkText><title></title></link>
